definition: to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Save the debates for when you're with friends whose opinions matter to you.
sentences.chinese: 想评理的话，找朋友说去吧，他们的意见才重要。

sentences.english: Those close to your heart may be difficult to reason with.
sentences.chinese: 很难与那些心灵相惜的人评理。

sentences.english: To find the commissar reason, LiBiao WangZhengWei just let him keep sufficient flesh.
sentences.chinese: 不甘心的李彪找政委评理，王政委只是让他养足肉体。

sentences.english: Children find they judge to go, want to drag his son to go with strong meter.
sentences.chinese: 儿找他们评理去，还想拖着儿子米强一块儿去。

definition: so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
not distinguishing red-green or black-white (idiom)/not to distinguish between right and wrong
pinyin: bu4 wen4 qing1 hong2 zao4 bai2
